articles.title: Stephen Sondheim, groundbreaking theatre composer and lyricist, dead at 91 - CBC.ca
articles.description: Stephen Sondheim, the songwriter who reshaped American musical theatre in the second half of the 20th century with his intelligent, intricately rhymed lyrics, his use of evocative melodies and his willingness to tackle unusual subjects, has died. He was 91.

articles.title: Stephen Sondheim, Titan of the American Musical, Is Dead at 91 - The New York Times
articles.description: He was the theater’s most revered and influential composer-lyricist of the last half of the 20th century and the driving force behind some of Broadway’s most beloved and celebrated shows.

articles.title: The first carbon dioxide cold trap on the moon was confirmed-Mis-aisa-The - MIS Asia
articles.description: According to a recent report by the physicist organization network, after decades of research, American scientists have confirmed for the first time that there is a cold trap that may contain solid carbon dioxide on the moon.
